content:
TITLE: Complete Example of Request Object Usage in Bruno
DESCRIPTION: A comprehensive example showing the structure of a request object and how to access its various properties including authentication credentials, headers, method, URL, and more.
SOURCE: https://github.com/usebruno/bruno-docs/blob/main/src/pages/testing/script/request/request-object.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
// Example request object
const req = {
  assertions: [],
  auth: { username: 'myUsername', password: 'mySuperPassword' },
  headers: {
    authorization: 'Bearer <token>',
    'content-type': 'application/json',
    accept: 'application/json',
    // Add more headers as needed...
  },
  method: 'GET',
  mode: 'none',
  responseType: 'arraybuffer',
  script: {
    req: "// Create an array of objects\nconst data = [\n  { iâ€¦q);\nconst myVariable = bru.getEnvVar('password');"
  },
  signal: {},
  url: '{{base.url}}/users/2?queryTest=queryResult',
  vars: {}
};


// Accessing request properties
console.log(req.method); // Output: "GET"
console.log(req.url); // Output: "{{base.url}}/users/2?queryTest=queryResult"
console.log(req.headers.authorization); // Output: "Bearer <token>"
console.log(req.auth.username); // Output: "myUsername"
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Bruno Collection with JSON Data File
DESCRIPTION: Executes a Bruno API collection using data from a specified JSON file. This feature requires Bruno CLI version 1.35.0 or higher and enables complex data structures for API testing or operations.
SOURCE: https://github.com/usebruno/bruno-docs/blob/main/src/pages/bru-cli/runCollection.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
bru run folder --json-file-path /path/to/json/file.json
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Writing API Tests with Chai Assertions in Bruno
DESCRIPTION: Example of automated test scripts for API requests in Bruno using Chai assertion library. The script demonstrates how to check for successful login by validating HTTP status code and how to verify the expected JSON response body structure.
SOURCE: https://github.com/usebruno/bruno-docs/blob/main/src/pages/testing/tests/introduction.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
test("should be able to login", function () {
  const data = res.getBody();
  expect(res.getStatus()).to.equal(200);
});

test("should return json", function () {
  const data = res.getBody();
  expect(res.getBody()).to.eql({
    hello: "Bruno",
  });
});
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Getting Runtime Variables in Pre-request Scripts
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to retrieve runtime variable values using bru.getVar() within pre-request scripts and use them to set request headers programmatically.
SOURCE: https://github.com/usebruno/bruno-docs/blob/main/src/pages/get-started/variables/runtime-variables.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
const token = bru.getVar("token");
req.setHeader("Authorization", `Bearer ${token}`);
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Importing and Using JavaScript Functions in Bruno
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to import a JavaScript function from a file and use it in a Bruno script. It includes finding a user by ID, setting a variable, and using it in a URL.
SOURCE: https://github.com/usebruno/bruno-docs/blob/main/src/pages/testing/script/js-file.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
import { getUserById } from './users.js';

const user = getUserById(2);
bru.setVar('val', user.id);

// URL: https://reqres.in/api/users/{{val}}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting Runtime Variables in Bruno
DESCRIPTION: Sets a runtime variable from response data
SOURCE: https://github.com/usebruno/bruno-docs/blob/main/src/pages/testing/script/javascript-reference.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_30

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
let data = res.getBody();
bru.setVar("petId", data.id);
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Writing JavaScript Tests for API Responses in Bruno
DESCRIPTION: This example demonstrates how to write JavaScript test scripts in Bruno for API testing. The code validates a successful login with a 200 status code check and verifies the response body matches the expected JSON structure. These tests use Chai's expect syntax.
SOURCE: https://github.com/usebruno/bruno-docs/blob/main/src/pages/get-started/bruno-basics/create-a-test.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
test("should be able to login", function () {
  const data = res.getBody();
  expect(res.getStatus()).to.equal(200);
});

test("should return json", function () {
  const data = res.getBody();
  expect(res.getBody()).to.eql({
    hello: "Bruno",
  });
});
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: POST Request with JSON Body and Headers in Bruno
DESCRIPTION: Illustrates a POST request with a JSON body and custom headers using Bruno syntax. It sends a text message via an API, including API key, recipient number, and message content.
SOURCE: https://github.com/usebruno/bruno-docs/blob/main/src/pages/bru-lang/samples.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
post {
  url: https://api.textlocal.in/send
}

body {
  {
    "apiKey": "secret",
    "numbers": "9988776655",
    "message": "Woof! lets play with some apis"
  }
}

headers {
  content-type: application/json
  Authorization: Bearer topsecret
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: POST Request with Automated Testing in Bruno
DESCRIPTION: Shows a POST request for login with automated testing using Bruno syntax. It includes two tests: one to check the response status code and another to verify the presence of a token in the response body.
SOURCE: https://github.com/usebruno/bruno-docs/blob/main/src/pages/bru-lang/samples.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
post {
  url: https://api.textlocal.in/login
}

body {
  {
    "username": "johnnash",
    "password": "governingdynamics"
  }
}

tests {
  test("should be able to login", function() {
    expect(res.status).to.equal(201);
  });

  test("should receive the token", function() {
    expect(res.body.token).to.be.a('string');
  });
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Getting Response Body in Bruno
DESCRIPTION: Retrieves the response body data
SOURCE: https://github.com/usebruno/bruno-docs/blob/main/src/pages/testing/script/javascript-reference.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_18

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
let data = res.getBody();
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using Runtime Variables in Request Headers
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to reference a runtime variable in request headers using the {{variableName}} syntax. This technique allows dynamically injecting stored values like tokens into request headers.
SOURCE: https://github.com/usebruno/bruno-docs/blob/main/src/pages/get-started/variables/runtime-variables.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
Authorization: Bearer {{token}}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Debugging Variables in Bruno Console
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to access and debug different types of variables using the Bruno console API. Shows the basic pattern for accessing runtime variables using bru.getVar().
SOURCE: https://github.com/usebruno/bruno-docs/blob/main/src/pages/get-started/variables/overview.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
// Basic syntax: console.log(bru.get[Type]Var(key))
console.log(bru.getVar('myVar'))           // Runtime variables
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Getting Response Header in Bruno
DESCRIPTION: Retrieves a specific header from the response
SOURCE: https://github.com/usebruno/bruno-docs/blob/main/src/pages/testing/script/javascript-reference.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_16

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
let transactionId = res.getHeader("transaction-id");
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using Chai Assertion Library in Bruno
DESCRIPTION: Example demonstrating how to use the Chai assertion library in Bruno with CommonJS syntax. The code imports Chai, defines a simple add function, tests it with an assertion, and logs a success message.
SOURCE: https://github.com/usebruno/bruno-docs/blob/main/src/pages/testing/script/inbuilt-libraries.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
const chai = require('chai');

const { expect } = chai;

function add(a, b) {
  return a + b;
}

const result = add(2, 3);

expect(result).to.equal(5);

console.log('Test passed!');
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Creating Text Blocks in Bru Files
DESCRIPTION: This example shows how to define text blocks in a Bru file. It includes a 'body' block with JSON content and a 'tests' block with a JavaScript assertion.
SOURCE: https://github.com/usebruno/bruno-docs/blob/main/src/pages/bru-lang/language.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
body {
  {
    "hello": "world"
  }
}

tests {
  expect(res.status).to.equal(200);
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Storing OAuth2 Access Token in Collection-Level Script
DESCRIPTION: This script captures the access token from an OAuth2 response and stores it in a runtime variable at the collection level. It checks if the authentication mode is OAuth2 and if the response contains an access token before saving it to a variable named 'access_token_set_by_collection_script'.
SOURCE: https://github.com/usebruno/bruno-docs/blob/main/src/pages/auth/oauth2/password-credentials.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
if(req.getAuthMode() == 'oauth2' && res.body.access_token) {
    bru.setVar('access_token_set_by_collection_script', res.body.access_token);
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Defining Path Parameters in Bruno Requests
DESCRIPTION: The 'params:path' tag is used to define path parameters for a request, replacing placeholders in the URL.
SOURCE: https://github.com/usebruno/bruno-docs/blob/main/src/pages/bru-lang/tag-reference.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_10

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
get {
  url: https://api.textlocal.in/user/:userId
}

params:path {
  userId: 13
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting Variables in Pre-Request and Post-Response Sections in Bruno
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to set variables before a request and after receiving a response in Bruno. Pre-request variables can be any valid JavaScript literal, while post-response variables can use the 'res' object to parse the response.
SOURCE: https://github.com/usebruno/bruno-docs/blob/main/src/pages/testing/script/vars.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
// Pre Request Variables
name = "John Doe"
age = 30
isActive = true

// Post Response Variables
token = res.body.token
userId = res.body.user.id
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Sending GET Request in Bruno
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates a simple GET request to the GitHub API using Bruno syntax. It fetches user information for the 'usebruno' account.
SOURCE: https://github.com/usebruno/bruno-docs/blob/main/src/pages/bru-lang/samples.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
get {
  url: https://api.github.com/users/usebruno
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Accessing Request Variables in JavaScript Scripts
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to get request variable values inside scripts using the bru.getRequestVar() function. This allows you to retrieve and use request variables programmatically within Bruno's scripting environment.
SOURCE: https://github.com/usebruno/bruno-docs/blob/main/src/pages/get-started/variables/request-variables.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
let source = bru.getRequestVar("source");
let destination = bru.getRequestVar("destination");
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Generating Multiple Reports Simultaneously with Bruno CLI
DESCRIPTION: This command demonstrates how to generate JSON, JUnit, and HTML reports simultaneously using Bruno CLI. It creates three separate output files for different analysis needs.
SOURCE: https://github.com/usebruno/bruno-docs/blob/main/src/pages/bru-cli/builtInReporters.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
bru run request.bru --reporter-json results.json --reporter-junit results.xml --reporter-html results.html
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting HTTP Headers in Bruno Requests
DESCRIPTION: The 'headers' tag is used to define HTTP headers for a request.
SOURCE: https://github.com/usebruno/bruno-docs/blob/main/src/pages/bru-lang/tag-reference.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_11

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
get {
  url: https://api.textlocal.in/send?apiKey=secret&numbers=9988776655&message=hello
}

headers {
  content-type: application/json
  Authorization: Bearer topsecret
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Bruno CLI Tests with HTML Reporter
DESCRIPTION: This command runs API tests using Bruno CLI and generates an HTML report. The command should be executed from the root folder of your Bruno collection and will create a results.html file containing the test results.
SOURCE: https://github.com/usebruno/bruno-docs/blob/main/src/pages/testing/automate-test/automate-test.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
bru run --reporter-html results.html
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Array Mapping Query Example in JavaScript
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to transform array elements using a mapper function when querying the response.
SOURCE: https://github.com/usebruno/bruno-docs/blob/main/src/pages/testing/script/response/response-query.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
res('..items..amount[?]', amt => amt + 10)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Whitelisting Multiple Modules in Bruno
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to whitelist multiple Node.js modules (crypto, jwt, child_process) in the bruno.json file for use in Bruno scripts. This configuration allows scripts to access these specific modules while maintaining security restrictions.
SOURCE: https://github.com/usebruno/bruno-docs/blob/main/src/pages/testing/script/whitelisting-modules.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
 "scripts": {
      "moduleWhitelist": ["crypto", "jwt", "child_process"],
      "filesystemAccess": {
        "allow": true
      }
    }
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting Multiple Request Headers in Bruno
DESCRIPTION: Sets multiple headers at once using an object
SOURCE: https://github.com/usebruno/bruno-docs/blob/main/src/pages/testing/script/javascript-reference.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
req.setHeaders({
  "content-type": "application/json",
  "transaction-id": "foobar"
});
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Accessing Response Properties in Bruno
DESCRIPTION: This example demonstrates how to access properties of a response object in Bruno. It shows the structure of a typical response object with body, headers, and status properties and how to retrieve values from each component.
SOURCE: https://github.com/usebruno/bruno-docs/blob/main/src/pages/testing/script/response/response-object.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
// Example response object
const res = {
  body: '{"message": "Hello, world!"}',
  headers: {
    'Content-Type': 'application/json',
    'Cache-Control': 'no-cache',
  },
  status: 200,
};

// Accessing response properties
console.log(res.body); // Output: '{"message": "Hello, world!"}'
console.log(res.headers['Content-Type']); // Output: 'application/json'
console.log(res.status); // Output: 200
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Deep Navigation Query Example in JavaScript
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to use double dots (..) for deep navigation through nested objects in the response.
SOURCE: https://github.com/usebruno/bruno-docs/blob/main/src/pages/testing/script/response/response-query.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
res('..items.amount')
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: GET Request with Custom Headers in Bruno
DESCRIPTION: Shows how to send a GET request with custom headers using Bruno syntax. It includes content-type and Authorization headers for a text messaging API call.
SOURCE: https://github.com/usebruno/bruno-docs/blob/main/src/pages/bru-lang/samples.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
get {
  url: https://api.textlocal.in/send?apiKey=secret&numbers=9988776655&message=hello
}

headers {
  content-type: application/json
  Authorization: Bearer topsecret
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting Request Method in Bruno
DESCRIPTION: Sets the HTTP method for the request
SOURCE: https://github.com/usebruno/bruno-docs/blob/main/src/pages/testing/script/javascript-reference.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
req.setMethod("POST");
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: POST Request with Post-Response Scripting in Bruno
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates a POST request for login with post-response scripting in Bruno syntax. It sets a variable 'token' with the response body's token value after the request is completed.
SOURCE: https://github.com/usebruno/bruno-docs/blob/main/src/pages/bru-lang/samples.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
post {
  url: https://api.textlocal.in/login
}

body {
  {
    "username": "johnnash",
    "password": "governingdynamics"
  }
}

script:post-response {
  bru.setVar("token", res.body.token);
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Defining Tests in Bruno
DESCRIPTION: The 'body:test' tag is used to define tests that run against the response.
SOURCE: https://github.com/usebruno/bruno-docs/blob/main/src/pages/bru-lang/tag-reference.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_21

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
body:test {
  expect(res.status).to.equal(200);
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Creating GraphQL Request Steps
DESCRIPTION: Steps for creating a new GraphQL request in Bruno, including selecting request type, providing URL and name, and creating the request. The default HTTP method is POST but can be adjusted as needed.
SOURCE: https://github.com/usebruno/bruno-docs/blob/main/src/pages/send-requests/graphql/graphql-api.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_0



----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Bruno CLI with Vault Cloud Authentication
DESCRIPTION: CLI command for executing Bruno with Vault Cloud authentication. This command runs a folder of requests while passing all required client credentials and project information as environment variables.
SOURCE: https://github.com/usebruno/bruno-docs/blob/main/src/pages/secrets-management/hashicorp-vault/using-with-cli.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
bru run folder --env Prod --env-var tokenEndpoint=your-token-endpoint --env-var secretsEndpoint=your-secrets-endpoint --env-var clientId=your-client-id --env-var clientSecret=your-client-secret --env-var projectName=your-project-name --env-var projectId=your-project-id --env-var organizationId=your-organization-id
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Making PUT HTTP Requests in Bruno
DESCRIPTION: The 'put' tag is used to make a PUT HTTP call, specifying the URL to be requested.
SOURCE: https://github.com/usebruno/bruno-docs/blob/main/src/pages/bru-lang/tag-reference.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
put {
  url: https://api.github.com/users/usebruno
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Making GET HTTP Requests in Bruno
DESCRIPTION: The 'get' tag is used to make a GET HTTP call, specifying the URL to be requested.
SOURCE: https://github.com/usebruno/bruno-docs/blob/main/src/pages/bru-lang/tag-reference.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
get {
  url: https://api.github.com/users/usebruno
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Stopping Collection Execution with stopExecution in Bruno
DESCRIPTION: Use this function to terminate the collection run completely. It can be called from pre-request scripts, post-request scripts, or test scripts, but is only effective within the context of a collection run.
SOURCE: https://github.com/usebruno/bruno-docs/blob/main/src/pages/testing/script/javascript-reference.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_37

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
bru.runner.stopExecution();
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Request by Path in Bruno
DESCRIPTION: Executes a request by its path and retrieves response
SOURCE: https://github.com/usebruno/bruno-docs/blob/main/src/pages/testing/script/javascript-reference.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_34

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
const requestResponse = await bru.runRequest("echo/echo json");
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Generating Test Data with Dynamic Variables in JSON
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to use dynamic variables to generate random user data including ID, name, email, phone, and address information.
SOURCE: https://github.com/usebruno/bruno-docs/blob/main/src/pages/testing/script/dynamic-variables.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
  "user": {
    "id": "{{$randomUUID}}",
    "name": "{{$randomFullName}}",
    "email": "{{$randomEmail}}",
    "phone": "{{$randomPhoneNumber}}",
    "address": {
      "street": "{{$randomStreetAddress}}",
      "city": "{{$randomCity}}",
      "country": "{{$randomCountry}}"
    }
  }
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Making Synchronous HTTP Request with Axios in Bruno Scripts
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to make a synchronous GET request to GitHub API using axios library and store the response data in Bruno variables. The example fetches a user's avatar URL from GitHub and sets it as a Bruno variable.
SOURCE: https://github.com/usebruno/bruno-docs/blob/main/src/pages/testing/script/request/sync-requests.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
const axios = require("axios");

const response = await axios.get("https://api.github.com/users/usebruno");

bru.setVar("avatarUrl", response.data.avatar_url);
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Creating a Runtime Variable in Bruno
DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to set a runtime variable using the bru.setVar() function to store a token from a response body. This allows capturing dynamic values from responses for use in subsequent requests.
SOURCE: https://github.com/usebruno/bruno-docs/blob/main/src/pages/get-started/variables/runtime-variables.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
bru.setVar("token", res.body.token);
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Skipping Requests with skipRequest in Bruno
DESCRIPTION: This function allows skipping the execution of the current request during a collection run. It can only be used within pre-request scripts and is only effective within the context of a collection run.
SOURCE: https://github.com/usebruno/bruno-docs/blob/main/src/pages/testing/script/javascript-reference.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_36

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
bru.runner.skipRequest();
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Controlling Request Flow with setNextRequest in Bruno
DESCRIPTION: Use this function to change the default sequential execution order by specifying the next request to execute. This function can only be used within post-request scripts or test scripts during a collection run.
SOURCE: https://github.com/usebruno/bruno-docs/blob/main/src/pages/testing/script/javascript-reference.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_35

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
bru.runner.setNextRequest("Get process status");
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Defining XML Request Body in Bruno
DESCRIPTION: The 'body:xml' tag is used to define an XML request body.
SOURCE: https://github.com/usebruno/bruno-docs/blob/main/src/pages/bru-lang/tag-reference.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_14

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
body:xml {
  <xml>
    <name>John</name>
    <age>30</age>
  </xml>
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Bruno Collection with CSV Data File
DESCRIPTION: Executes a Bruno API collection using data from a specified CSV file. This command allows for data-driven testing or bulk API operations using CSV-formatted input.
SOURCE: https://github.com/usebruno/bruno-docs/blob/main/src/pages/bru-cli/runCollection.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
bru run folder --csv-file-path /path/to/csv/file.csv
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Defining JSON Request Body in Bruno
DESCRIPTION: The 'body' tag is used to define a JSON request body.
SOURCE: https://github.com/usebruno/bruno-docs/blob/main/src/pages/bru-lang/tag-reference.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_12

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
body {
  {
    username: 'john',
    password: 'governingdynamics'
  }
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Storing OAuth2 Access Token in Request-Level Script
DESCRIPTION: This script captures the access token from an OAuth2 response and stores it in a runtime variable at the request level. It saves the access token from the response body to a variable named 'access_token_set_by_request_script' for use in subsequent requests.
SOURCE: https://github.com/usebruno/bruno-docs/blob/main/src/pages/auth/oauth2/password-credentials.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
bru.setVar('access_token_set_by_request_script', res.body.access_token);
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Defining Form URL-Encoded Request Body in Bruno
DESCRIPTION: The 'body:form-urlencoded' tag is used to define a form URL-encoded request body.
SOURCE: https://github.com/usebruno/bruno-docs/blob/main/src/pages/bru-lang/tag-reference.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_15

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
body:form-urlencoded {
  apikey: secret
  numbers: +91998877665
  ~message: hello
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Creating JSON Data File for Bruno Collection Runner
DESCRIPTION: Sample JSON file structure containing an array of objects with name and job fields for data-driven testing in Bruno.
SOURCE: https://github.com/usebruno/bruno-docs/blob/main/src/pages/testing/tests/data-driven-testing.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
[
```

TITLE: Complete Postman to Bruno Conversion Example
DESCRIPTION: Comprehensive example showing how to read a Postman collection file, convert it to Bruno format, and save it to a new file using async/await and file system operations
SOURCE: https://github.com/usebruno/bruno-docs/blob/main/src/pages/converters/overview.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
const { postmanToBruno } = require('@usebruno/converters');
const fs = require('fs/promises');

function convertPostmanToBruno(inputFile, outputFile) {
  // Read Postman collection file
  fs.readFile(inputFile, 'utf8')
    .then(inputData => {
      // Convert to Bruno collection
      return postmanToBruno(JSON.parse(inputData));
    })
    .then(brunoCollection => {
      // Save Bruno collection
      return fs.writeFile(outputFile, JSON.stringify(brunoCollection, null, 2));
    })
    .then(() => {
      console.log('Conversion successful!');
    })
    .catch(error => {
      console.error('Error during conversion:', error);
    });
}

// Usage
convertPostmanToBruno('postman-collection.json', 'bruno-collection.json');
```

TITLE: Example OpenAPI Specification Export Structure
DESCRIPTION: Sample YAML structure showing how a Bruno collection is exported to OpenAPI Specification V3 format. Includes basic API information, endpoint definitions, parameters, and component schemas.
SOURCE: https://github.com/usebruno/bruno-docs/blob/main/src/pages/open-api/exportOAS.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
openapi: 3.0.0
info:
  title: Example API
  version: 1.0.0
  description: API documentation exported from Bruno
paths:
  /users:
    get:
      summary: Get all users
      parameters:
        - name: limit
          in: query
          schema:
            type: integer
      responses:
        '200':
          description: Successful response
          content:
            application/json:
              schema:
                type: array
                items:
                  $ref: '#/components/schemas/User'
components:
  schemas:
    User:
      type: object
      properties:
        id:
          type: integer
        name:
          type: string
```

```
}
```

TITLE: Rendering Table Visualization using react-table in JavaScript
DESCRIPTION: This example shows how to use the react-table provider to render a large table visualization with custom column definitions, including custom headers and filter variants.
SOURCE: https://github.com/usebruno/bruno-docs/blob/main/src/pages/advanced-guides/visualize.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
const rowData1 = Array.from({ length: 2500 })
  .map((_) => [
    { firstName: 'Tanner', lastName: 'Linsley', age: 24, visits: 100 },
    { firstName: 'Tandy', lastName: 'Miller', age: 40, visits: 40 },
    { firstName: 'Joe', lastName: 'Dirte', age: 45, visits: 20 },
  ]).flat();


const columnDefinitions1 = [
  {
    id: "firstName",
    cell: (info) => info.getValue(),
    header: () => `<span className="flex flex-start">First Name</span>`,
    meta: { filterVariant: "text" },
  },
  {
    id: "lastName",
    cell: (info) => info.getValue(),
    header: () => `<span className="flex flex-start">Last Name</span>`,
    meta: { filterVariant: "text" },
  },
  // Additional column definitions here...
];

bru.visualize('table', {
  name: 'table2',
  provider: 'react-table',
  props: { rowData: rowData1, columnDefinitions: columnDefinitions1 }
});
```

TITLE: Configuring Vault Server with AppRole Authentication in Bruno CLI
DESCRIPTION: Configuration for secrets.json to connect to a Vault server using appRole authentication. This setup provides more granular access control when connecting Bruno CLI to Vault.
SOURCE: https://github.com/usebruno/bruno-docs/blob/main/src/pages/secrets-management/hashicorp-vault/using-with-cli.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
  "type": "vault",
  "cli": {
    "type": "vault-server",
    "vaultServerConfig": {
      "url": "http://localhost:8200",
      "namespace": "bruno",
      "auth": {
        "method": "app_role",
        "appRole": {
          "role": "bruno",
          "roleId": "{{roleId}}",
          "secretId": "{{secretId}}"
        }
      }
    }
  }
  "data": [
    {
      "environment": "Prod",
      "secrets": [
        {
          "name": "db",
          "path": "secret/db",
          "enabled": true
        }
      ]
    }
  ]
}
```

TITLE: Client Certificate Configuration JSON Structure
DESCRIPTION: JSON structure for configuring client certificates with Bruno CLI. The configuration includes certificate details for different domains, supporting both .crt/.key pairs and .pfx files with optional passphrases.
SOURCE: https://github.com/usebruno/bruno-docs/blob/main/src/pages/bru-cli/commandOptions.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_9

LANGUAGE: json
CODE:
```
{
  "enabled": true,
  "certs": [
    {
      "domain": "usebruno.com",
      "type": "cert",
      "certFilePath": "certs/server_1.crt",
      "keyFilePath": "private/server_1.key",
      "passphrase": "Iu$eBrun0_#Secure!"
    },
    {
      "domain": "the-example.com",
      "type": "pfx",
      "pfxFilePath": "pfx/server_3.pfx",
      "passphrase": "L!ghT_Y@g@mi_2024!"
    }
  ]
}
```

TITLE: Rendering Postman to Bruno Translator Page in React
DESCRIPTION: This React component renders a page for the Postman to Bruno scripts translator. It imports the Translator component and available themes, then renders a title, description, and the Translator component with the provided themes.
SOURCE: https://github.com/usebruno/bruno-docs/blob/main/src/pages/get-started/import-export-data/script-translator.mdx#2025-04-17_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: JavaScript
CODE:
```
import { Translator } from '../../../components/translator/translator'
import { AVAILABLE_THEMES } from '../../../components/translator/themes'

export default function Page() {
  return (
    <>
      <h1>Scripts Translator</h1>
      <p>Welcome to the <strong>Postman</strong> to <strong>Bruno</strong> scripts translator. \
      This is the same function that runs behind the <strong>Import Postman Collection</strong> feature in Bruno</p>
      <Translator themes={AVAILABLE_THEMES} />
    </>
  )
}
```

```
       target="_blank" 
       rel="noopener noreferrer">

);
```
